generalInfo:
This 9-day journey through Ecuador’s Andean highlands weaves together rich cultural heritage and awe-inspiring natural landscapes, offering a deep dive into the heart of the country. From colonial cities to volcanic peaks, indigenous markets to ancient ruins, each day introduces a new layer of Ecuador’s vibrant identity.

You’ll begin in Quito, a UNESCO World Heritage Site where ornate churches and cobbled streets speak to centuries of history. Explore the Church of La Compañía and climb the towers of the Basilica del Voto Nacional for panoramic city views. Then head just outside the city to the equator line at Mitad del Mundo—where science, geography, and culture converge in surprising ways.

Venture north to Otavalo’s renowned artisan market, alive with textiles and hand-woven crafts, and take in the peaceful beauty of Lake Cuicocha before heading south along the Avenue of the Volcanoes. Hike among wild horses and alpine landscapes in Cotopaxi National Park, and spend the night beneath the watchful peak of Chimborazo, Ecuador’s highest mountain.

Your journey continues to the Ingapirca ruins, the most important archaeological site in the country, before arriving in the graceful city of Cuenca. With its colonial architecture, flower-filled plazas, and thriving arts scene, Cuenca is one of South America’s best-kept secrets. From here, explore the glacial lakes and mist-covered trails of Cajas National Park, then descend to the tropical lowlands of Guayaquil.

In Guayaquil, stroll along the waterfront promenade, climb to the colorful hilltop neighborhood of Las Peñas, and share the city’s parks with free-roaming iguanas. This tour is a rich tapestry of highlands and heritage, wild nature and warm culture—perfect for travelers seeking a well-rounded, immersive Ecuadorian experience.

dayInfo.description: (Arrive In Quito) Upon your arrival in Quito, a private transfer will take you to your hotel. You will then have the opportunity to explore Quito’s colonial center, a designated UNESCO World Heritage Site.

(Quito City Tour & Middle Of The World Monument) Begin your day with a guided tour of Quito’s historic center, a UNESCO World Heritage Site. Your tour includes a visit to the impressive Church of La Compañía, celebrated for its baroque architecture and intricate gold-leaf interior. Continue to the Basilica del Voto Nacional and ascend its towers for expansive panoramic views of the city. In the afternoon, journey to the Mitad del Mundo to stand on the equatorial line and visit the Intiñan Museum, where you will learn about the unique geographical and cultural significance of this remarkable location. Meals: Breakfast

(Otavalo Market & Lake Cuicocha) Travel north to the vibrant city of Otavalo, renowned for its indigenous market brimming with colorful textiles, exquisite hand-woven crafts, and traditional clothing. Engage with local artisans and gain insight into their unique craft techniques. Later, proceed to Lake Cuicocha, a breathtaking crater lake formed by volcanic activity. Enjoy a brief hike along the lake's edge, absorbing the stunning views and admiring the distinctive flora. The day also includes a visit to the charming leather town of Cotacachi before your return to Quito. Meals: Breakfast / Lunch

(Cotopaxi National Park & Riobamba) Embark on a trip to Cotopaxi National Park, home to one of the world's highest active volcanoes, standing at 19,347 feet (5,897 meters). Explore the park’s distinctive high-altitude ecosystem, and if conditions permit, undertake a hike to the José Rivas Refuge at 15,780 feet (4,810 meters). Watch for native wildlife such as wild horses, Andean foxes, and condors. Following your visit to the park, travel to the city of Riobamba, nestled in the shadow of Chimborazo, Ecuador’s highest mountain. Meals: Breakfast

(Ingapirca Ruins & Cuenca) Journey south to explore the ancient ruins of Ingapirca, recognized as the most significant Inca archaeological site in Ecuador. Your knowledgeable guide will illuminate the history and profound significance of these stone structures, originally built by the Cañari people and later occupied by the Incas. A highlight of this site is the Temple of the Sun, historically used for ceremonial purposes and astronomical observations. The day continues with your arrival in Cuenca, a city celebrated for its remarkably preserved colonial architecture and dynamic cultural scene. Meals: Breakfast

(Cuenca City Tour) Discover the charm of Cuenca with a comprehensive guided city tour. Visit major attractions including the New Cathedral, distinguished by its blue domes, and the vibrant flower market in the Plaza de las Flores. Explore the Museum of Modern Art and the Pumapungo Archaeological Park to gain deeper insights into the region’s rich history and artistic traditions. The day concludes with a leisurely stroll along the Tomebamba River, where you can admire the scenic blend of colonial and modern architecture. Meals: Breakfast

(Cajas National Park & Transfer To Guayaquil) Depart from Cuenca to Cajas National Park, an area renowned for its rugged landscapes and numerous glacial lakes. Engage in a guided hike through the park to observe its unique flora and fauna, including llamas and various bird species. Following your exploration, descend from the highlands to the vibrant coastal city of Guayaquil. The shift in climate and scenery is notable as you transition from the cool, misty highlands to the warm, tropical environment of the lowlands. Meals: Breakfast

(Guayaquil City Tour) Explore Ecuador’s largest city with a guided tour of its vibrant neighborhoods and historic sites. Enjoy a leisurely stroll along the scenic Malecon 2000, a riverfront promenade adorned with parks, monuments, and cafes. Visit Las Peñas, the city’s oldest neighborhood, where you can ascend the 444 steps to Cerro Santa Ana for panoramic views of Guayaquil and the Guayas River. The tour concludes with a visit to Parque Seminario, famously known for its free-roaming iguanas. Meals: Breakfast

(Departure) Following breakfast, you will be comfortably transferred to the Guayaquil International Airport for your flight home or to your next destination, marking the end of your Andean adventure. Meals: Breakfast
